result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Lee Aherns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is set at -0- to Angeline Miller.  If during the period of supervision, a claim for restitution is made the Def will be notified!  
AMENDED 12/18/15 - $332.49 owing to City of Ashland Police Deptmt.

While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
Added to current pymt plan & to begin paying 1 mo of release fr jail.
To seek, obtain and maintain full time employment.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendations.  Def to sign release of information to DOC.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
Def to have NO contact w/Angeline Miller or her residence.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department
Concurrent with: Ashland County case 15CF94 Counts 1&2 but CONSECUTIVE to 15CF218 Counts 2,6,7,8 and 15CF94 Count 3

superMiscConds.notes: Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendations.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are consumed.
NO ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH ANGELINE MILLER, may not visit without invite, but may have contact telephonically, electronically and in writing. Court modifies civil Restraining Order in 15CV104 so that it comports with what the court has ordered as a condition of Extended Supervision.
The Court encourages DOC to have Treatment Options.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

Restitution to Ashland Police Department
601 W Main St
Ashland, WI 54806

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jesse Lee Aherns in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. agreement with cases. DA would like SEHR cases first. offer to settle from AUG 2 date the agreement for open cases. DA Ruth Kressel 15CF218 CT 2 and 6, 300 days incarceration. 225 days credit concurrent. 15CF218 ct 1 and 15CF94 ct1,2 joint 1 year in car. 2 years extended supervision. credit 6 days. consecutive to 2,6 but concurrent to each other. State complied with victim rights. 15CF218 RTH and A. Miller would like to make a statement, also on the open cases. 15CF94 ct 3 Judge comments if there is interplay with the other cts. Back on record. Ct 3 will work with other charges 2,6 300 days credit 225. concurrent  with 15CF218, 7,8 15CF94 ct 3. 15CF218 ct1 15CT94 CT 1,2 1 year 4 months and  2 years extended super. Angeline Miller makes statements. Def is grandson. Always has been part of his life. Wants court to order supervision. Would like the def to write him and visit with vic, but not live with her. victim  to pay RHT to brothers.Maybe around $800. Ct questions why he owes this to the brother not to her. $800 is what is due to the brothers of whatever he has taken to sell of theirs. Vic is not making any claim for RHT. but maybe to leave that option open. Prior conviction at the init time of sent. Atty comments on the SEHR cases. will dispose of the battery to he can participate. Open cases will be consecutive on SEHR. will give him a punishment but rehabilitation  him. Def comments knows made a lot of mistakes wants to get back on his feet, is a good person. Been homeless for that past 3 years. Graduated High school. Had worked at Super one and other places. Court will follow the joint recommendation.  CT orders 15CF218 Ct 2,6 - sent 300 days in Co jail. run concurrent each other with the sentence in case 15cF94 ct3 15Cf218 7,8. on these 2 sentences 15CF218 ct 2,6 credit for days 225 days. fin obligation . must pay at COC office and civil judgment for those. 15CF218 ct 1 and 1 and 2 15CF94, each of these ct sentences to DOC for 3 years 4 months. 1 years 4 months init conf. 2 years supervision each ct. concurrent to each other. but consecutively to 152187,8 15cf94 ct 3 and and granted 6 days credit in each case. charges program and substances. Ct does find eligible both programs and they are granted. prison can be extended by bad time. 10 days  1st 20 days 2nd 40 3rd and more. Ct can make confinement up to the total length. Judge wants COC to encourage DOC to have treatment options. conditions of extended supervision are no abusive contact with Angeline Miller no visit without an invite can write. AODA follow through, absol, not consume mind altering substance. pres as pres, no presence where mind alerting substances, Mental health assessment and follow through, pay @ DOC ..  unless jail sentence 16CM96 16CM142 16CF194 open cases. will enter pleas as follow 16CF96 NC ct1, 16CM142 NC 1,2,3. 16CF194 NC 1,2. any other counts will be readin and dismissed. 16CM196 ct1 and 16cm142all and ct 1 in 16CM 194- 9 months Ashland CO jail concurrent to each other but consecutive to any other sentence. 16CF194 3 years extended supervision concurrent to jail sent in 16CM 196,16CM 142 and 16CM194 but consecutive to any other sentence. absol, random UA, RHT. No contact with Gary and Bonnie or residence or any drug users,no abusive contact with Angeline Miller, cognitive, DNA sample.  Def understands charges pleas NC to each Ct. DRI 16CM142 cts 4-9 are DRI 16CF194 cts 3 DRI. readin and dismissed. def sign's the plea questionnaire. understands Know and vol gives up rights. Def comments on unpaid fines and if warrant will be issues. FInes if there are any warrant they are cancelled. next payment 4/1/18 at $10 a month. Victim wants def to  be permitted to visit. Modify civil rest orders so is comports with what court ordered. Can write to her. has a rest orders. wants to accepts pleas of NC. Ct finds pleas have know and vol been given. know and vol waives rights. Accepts pleas and finds G. finds G of 16CM96 ct 1 and case 16CM142 1,2,3. 16CF194 Ct 1,2. State complied with victim rights. 16CF194 victim statement and RHT statement. Gary Leino is present, but no other statement besides what is in victim statement. eligible for both challenge program and substances abuse program. Atty has no comments. Def states that he is sorry, not in a clear frame of mind.  CT finds recommendation  is fair. will follow sentence guidelines. felony prison and mism. in JOC put recommendation  for DOC for programs. 2016CM196 Ct costs 465.15 one Ct. 16CM142-465.15 ct 1 and 2. ct 3 is 475.65. 16cm142 filing fee for civil fee. 164.50. CT 2 147 465.15 pay to the county. Payment plan April 2021. Ct 2 16CF194 auto theft. absol, counseling, take prev set conditions and include those is 194 CT 2. random testing cognitive therapy. DA has no position on RHT claim for the brothers. atty states vic will pay back. Ct orders pay back the $800 . RHT 1010. 6 order paid in this Mr leino then brothers. Jacob and Jordon  516 6th se west. RHT to Angline miller in an amount to be determined. if she decided to get a claim. MR leino first then the rest. DNA specimen, $578.13. pay through DOC on prison cases. no gun no vote. Extended supervision Gary or Bonnie Lenio or residence. no contact with known drug users or dealers. prison sent. CT 1 only 16CM196, 16CM162 ct 2 in 194- all mism cases 9 month jail each ct concurrent o days credit. Ct 1 194- DOC- 6 years - 3 years init and 3 years extended supervision . eligible for both programs, substance abuse and challenge program. 15CF218 ct 2,6 1 block of time already served concurrent. and 15CF218 1 and 194 1,2- another block concurrent to each other but both of these two block are consecutive to each other. All 2016 cases are concurrent within their block, but consecutive to the rest.
